author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Election Commission on Friday informed the Madras High Court that all details pertaining to new applications for inclusion, deletion, addition and shifting on the voters’ list have been uploaded in the Commission’s website from time to time.

The Additional Solicitor General, G. Rajagopalan, made the submission on a plea moved by Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) alleging that over 57 lakh bogus voters have been added to the voters list released by the Commission recently.

The petition sought the court to direct the Commission to appoint Central government officials as Electoral Registration Officers and to “purify” the entire voters list by verifying the applications.

The DMK wanted the court to pass an interim order directing the Commission to furnish a list of applications received after January 20 to the respective booth level agents of DMK to enable them to submit their response on each application.

When the petition came up for hearing before Justice R. Subbiah, Mr. Rajagopalan submitted that all information sought by the petitioner have been uploaded from time to time in the Commission’s website.

Recording the submission, the judge posted the matter to March 7 for the Commission to file counter affidavit.
title: ‘Details of new voters available on EC website’
